channel.title: Varbit.dat
channel.description:
Does anyone know for what varbit.dat is used for?
Thanks.

item.title: Varbit.dat
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Slay Pure Slay
item.description:
@Pure_Slay wrote:

[quote=“The Wanderer, post:9, topic:429962”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=532643.msg3898053#msg3898053 date=1327505391]

You’re referring to something like the states of the farming patches, correct? You wouldn’t want the server to have to replace all of the objects in some god awful manner, so the client contains different “permutations”.

Or is my understanding of the purpose off?
[/quote]
Correct, but it isn’t limited to that. I believe it can also be appended to npcs (transform perhaps, i.e., kalphite queen?), and interfaces. Like prayers can be deactivated through configs and farming patches can be sent into different stages.[/quote]

NPCs use a mask for changing the appearance of the entity in the appearance update block.

[quote=“sinisoul, post:19, topic:429962”][quote author=badger41 link=topic=532643.msg3908921#msg3908921 date=1328492783]
would varbit play a part in construction as well?
[/quote]

I don’t think it does at all. Or it does play a very little role.[/quote]

I think it may in the actual construction objects when you alter room objects. Build mode does not use varbit at all (except as stated above for adding objects into the map region). That is, as far as I know.

Read full topic

would varbit play a part in construction as well?

item.title: Varbit.dat
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

And why use a config for doors/trees when you can just replace the object? In farming it is kind of obvious why you wouldn’t do that, but I don’t see an issue with trees/doors. Would give the same effect.

Read full topic

item.title: Varbit.dat
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

zyle1992:

Would it be possible to create new settings? What I’m thinking of is for various objects, like trees and doors. The new config would be for, in the case of trees, the stump id, and in the case of doors, the setting would represent open/closed and the orientation.

Well if you take a look:

    public ObjectDefinition method580(boolean flag)
    {
        if(!flag)
            throw new NullPointerException();
        int i = -1;
        if(anInt774 != -1)
        {
            VarbitFile class37 = VarbitFile.aClass37Array646[anInt774];
            int j = class37.config_num;
            int k = class37.anInt649;
            int l = class37.anInt650;
            int i1 = Main.varbit_masks[l - k];
            i = main.configstates[j] >> k & i1;
        } else
        if(anInt749 != -1)
            i = main.configstates[anInt749];
        if(i < 0 || i >= anIntArray759.length || anIntArray759[i] == -1)
            return null;
        else
            return getObjectDefinition(anIntArray759[i]);
    }

Take note though that the purpose of the configuration in this example and as far as I know as just for changing the definition of the entity on the pallete. Such as in farming using a configuration that has variable bit files mapped to it that then changed the object id from the parsed value. I think it’d be a bit of a hack to do what you are requesting.

Read full topic

item.title: Varbit.dat
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Would it be possible to create new settings? What I’m thinking of is for various objects, like trees and doors. The new config would be for, in the case of trees, the stump id, and in the case of doors, the setting would represent open/closed and the orientation.

Read full topic

item.title: Varbit.dat
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Metho D, post:13, topic:429962”]Yes, some of them are used for npcs. A few examples off of the top of my head include:

[ul][]Balloon animals in the Prison Pete random event
[]Slayer masters after the While Guthix Sleep quest has been completed
[*]Various other monsters or people in quests[/ul][/quote]
oh, wow cool

Read full topic

item.title: Varbit.dat
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“The Wanderer, post:11, topic:429962”][quote author=Metho D link=topic=532643.msg3899019#msg3899019 date=1327593490]
I think the Kalphite Queen transformation just makes use of the npc appearance update that can change npcs from one type to another.

You’re right about farming patches and other “local” information, though.
[/quote]
That’s what I was unsure about. Not sure if they would use a config to trigger that update? Or would that just be redundant? Also, do you know if some configs are used for npcs, if so, any examples?[/quote]

Let me pull up an example:

    public NPCDefinition method161(int i)
    {
        int j = -1;
        if(i != 1834)
            aBoolean81 = !aBoolean81;
        if(varbitid != -1) {
            VarbitFile class37 = VarbitFile.aClass37Array646[varbitid];
            int k = class37.config_num;
            int l = class37.anInt649;
            int i1 = class37.anInt650;
            int j1 = Main.varbit_masks[i1 - l];
            j = main.configstates[k] >> l & j1;
        } else if(configid != -1)
            j = main.configstates[configid];
        if(j < 0 || j >= confignpcs.length || confignpcs[j] == -1)
            return null;
        else
            return getNPCDefinition(confignpcs[j]);
    }

I think you don’t need an explanation for that.

Read full topic

item.title: Varbit.dat
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

[quote=“Metho D, post:10, topic:429962”]I think the Kalphite Queen transformation just makes use of the npc appearance update that can change npcs from one type to another.

You’re right about farming patches and other “local” information, though.[/quote]
That’s what I was unsure about. Not sure if they would use a config to trigger that update? Or would that just be redundant? Also, do you know if some configs are used for npcs, if so, any examples?

Read full topic

item.title: Varbit.dat
item.dc:creator: @Metho_D Method
item.description:
@Metho_D wrote:

[quote=“The Wanderer, post:9, topic:429962”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=532643.msg3898053#msg3898053 date=1327505391]

You’re referring to something like the states of the farming patches, correct? You wouldn’t want the server to have to replace all of the objects in some god awful manner, so the client contains different “permutations”.

Or is my understanding of the purpose off?
[/quote]
Correct, but it isn’t limited to that. I believe it can also be appended to npcs (transform perhaps, i.e., kalphite queen?), and interfaces. Like prayers can be deactivated through configs and farming patches can be sent into different stages.[/quote]

I think the Kalphite Queen transformation just makes use of the npc appearance update that can change npcs from one type to another.

You’re right about farming patches and other “local” information, though.

Read full topic

item.title: Varbit.dat
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:7, topic:429962”]You’re referring to something like the states of the farming patches, correct? You wouldn’t want the server to have to replace all of the objects in some god awful manner, so the client contains different “permutations”.

Or is my understanding of the purpose off?[/quote]
Correct, but it isn’t limited to that. I believe it can also be appended to npcs (transform perhaps, i.e., kalphite queen?), and interfaces. Like prayers can be deactivated through configs and farming patches can be sent into different stages.

Read full topic

item.title: Varbit.dat
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:7, topic:429962”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=532643.msg3897436#msg3897436 date=1327442539]

Does anyone know for what varbit.dat is used for?

Thanks.

It’s meant to configure entities with multiple states through numeric representation.

What kind of configurations, like the interface configs? Or am I completely wrong?

Variable bit files are used in configuration setters. Variable bit files are mapped to configurations.

Ooh, secret quote message :P, I get it now.

And Hey, you’re a Java Guru! Congratz!

Thanks, and yes the answer was in the previous statement. I can pull up and example if you need it.
[/quote]

You’re referring to something like the states of the farming patches, correct? You wouldn’t want the server to have to replace all of the objects in some god awful manner, so the client contains different “permutations”.

Or is my understanding of the purpose off?[/quote]

It has multiple purposes, other than changing the object number. It is still currently used. I don’t have modern examples though.

Read full topic
